topics.title: International tours & selection watch
topics.summary: Tracking how the national sides are shaping up ahead of the Sri Lanka ODIs and the multi-format India tour.
topics.curatedCopy:
## Selection talking points
Australia's selectors are juggling workloads after a packed northern summer. The ODI squad for Sri Lanka features fringe quicks while the Test core keeps building toward the 2025 Ashes.

### Key notes
- Pat Cummins stays fresh with targeted overs in the Shield.
- Lance Morris and Nathan Ellis are on standby for the Sri Lanka white-ball swing.
- Spin depth is monitored closely with Todd Murphy and Matt Kuhnemann sharing red-ball duties.

callouts.title: Why it matters
callouts.markdown:
- World Cup Super League points hinge on the Sri Lanka results.
- India tour selections will be finalised before Christmas.

callouts.title: Fitness check
callouts.markdown: Mitchell Starc and Meg Lanning are both returning from managed breaks, easing back through limited-overs fixtures.

events.title: Australia names extended squad for Sri Lanka ODIs
events.description: Selectors add Jake Fraser-McGurk and Lance Morris to cover niggles for senior quicks while resting Travis Head for game one.

events.title: Spin camp convenes ahead of India Test tour
events.description: Todd Murphy, Matt Kuhnemann, and Tanveer Sangha work with Nathan Lyon at the Adelaide High Performance Centre.

events.title: Southern Stars recall Lanning for England series
events.description: Meg Lanning rejoins the multi-format squad while youngster Tess Flintoff earns a maiden call-up.

topics.title: Big Bash League build-up
topics.summary: Draft chatter, contract moves, and fixture reveals as BBL|14 and WBBL|10 take shape.
topics.curatedCopy:
## Summer hype
Clubs are finalising retention picks while chasing overseas signatures. Expect plenty of movement before the December opener.

#### What we're watching
- Sydney Sixers balancing veteran pillars with breakout quicks.
- Brisbane Heat using data scouting for a spin finisher.
- Adelaide Strikers WBBL side protecting its championship core.

callouts.title: Ticket demand
callouts.markdown: Opening night at the SCG is already tracking toward a sell-out with family zones doubling capacity.

events.title: Retention window locks in BBL captains
events.description: Moises Henriques and Usman Khawaja both recommit while Melbourne Stars lose an overseas marquee to the SA20.

events.title: WBBL double-headers confirmed for regional venues
events.description: Cricket Australia announces Ballarat and Mackay double-headers with standalone women’s fixtures in primetime slots.

events.title: Heat secure Afghan leggie in overseas draft
events.description: Brisbane Heat add Qais Ahmad to bolster their middle-over wicket options after a data-driven scouting process.

topics.title: Domestic pathways & grassroots
topics.summary: Shield, Marsh Cup, and Premier Cricket storylines feeding into national conversations.
topics.curatedCopy:
## State of play
Sheffield Shield finals positioning is tight while Premier Cricket seasons wrap up with grand finals around the country. The Marsh Cup adds one-day context for selectors eyeing depth.

### Standout efforts
1. Jordan Silk anchoring Tasmania with four straight half-centuries.
2. Phoebe Litchfield scoring big in WNCL to stay in the opener debate.
3. Emerging quicks Liam Haskett and Milly Illingworth bowling with pace and accuracy.

callouts.title: Grassroots spotlight
callouts.markdown: Community clubs in Darwin’s Strike League reported record membership growth after trialling twilight fixtures.

events.title: Shield batters pile on runs in Adelaide
events.description: NSW and South Australia combine for 1,100 runs with Ollie Davies and Jake Lehmann scoring centuries.

events.title: WNCL thriller sees Victoria edge Queensland
events.description: Katie Mack strikes 92 off 78 while Tess Flintoff defends nine in the final over at the Junction Oval.

events.title: Premier Cricket grand finals go under lights
events.description: Clubs in Perth and Brisbane debut twilight deciders in front of strong crowds and livestream audiences.

items.title: Australia call up Fraser-McGurk and Morris for Sri Lanka ODIs
items.content: Selector George Bailey says fresh pace options were needed with Mitchell Starc managed for the first two games.

items.title: Ellis eyes ODI debut after standout Marsh Cup form
items.content: Death-overs specialist Nathan Ellis has been told he is in the frame for game two in Hobart.

items.title: Murphy, Kuhnemann link with Lyon at specialist spin camp
items.content: Australia are fine-tuning their plans for the India tour with a spin summit hosted in Adelaide.

items.title: Meg Lanning returns as Flintoff earns maiden call-up
items.content: Tess Flintoff's breakout WNCL campaign is rewarded as the Southern Stars name a powerful squad for England.

items.title: BBL captains commit as retention window closes
items.content: Sixers and Heat re-sign their skippers while Stars lose an overseas marquee to South Africa's league.

items.title: Regional WBBL fixtures bring elite cricket to Ballarat
items.content: Ballarat will host its first WBBL games with the Renegades and Hurricanes in back-to-back clashes.

items.title: Mackay locks in primetime WBBL double-header
items.content: Queensland fans will see back-to-back Heat fixtures under lights with community activations planned across the weekend.

items.title: Heat land Qais Ahmad in BBL overseas draft
items.content: Data analytics drove the Heat's move for Qais Ahmad as they chase middle-over wickets.

items.title: Shield run glut keeps selectors busy
items.content: Ollie Davies and Jake Lehmann score centuries in a high-scoring draw that leaves NSW atop the table.

items.title: Silk extends hot streak to cement Tasmania’s finals charge
items.content: Jordan Silk’s fourth consecutive fifty keeps Tasmania within striking distance ahead of the Shield final push.

items.title: Flintoff defends final over as Victoria edge Queensland
items.content: Tess Flintoff held her nerve at Junction Oval with a clutch death over to keep Victoria’s WNCL finals hopes alive.

items.title: Premier Cricket grand finals embrace twilight audiences
items.content: Perth and Brisbane grand finals draw big online streams after shifting to evening start times.
